newsitem.title: JAPAN: Matsushita to join BSkyB digital TV venture -paper.
newsitem.headline: Matsushita to join BSkyB digital TV venture -paper.

text.p: Matsushita Electric Industrial Co will take a 10 to 20 percent stake in a digital television venture with British Sky Broadcasting, British Telecommunications Plc and Midland Bank, the Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported on Monday.
The new company will sell set-top box adapters for digital television broadcasting, it said.
The Nihon Keizai said the joint venture, estimated to be worth 500 million sterling, could be announced later this week.
Matsushita officials were unavailable for comment.

BSkyB, which is 40 percent owned by media tycoon Rupert Murdoch's News Corp, had been said to be negotiating the deal since late last year, and British media reports said the new company would be called Interactive Services Co.

Matsushita would provide set-top units which would allow home TV viewers to receive digital television transmissions, access the internet and use a broad range of interactive media services, the Nihon Keizai said.
News Corp also has a satellite broadcasting venture in Japan with Softbank Corp, called Japan Sky Broadcasting (JSkyB), in which Matsushita's rival Sony Corp is expected to be an equal partner.
